name: NPR
text: NPR’s Book Concierge has the largest batch of recommendations we’ve ever compiled – here are 380+ of our favorite 2020 titles. (And stick around to browse nearly 2,500 books from the last 8 years.) https://t.co/GTAiBdkhmg

name: NPR
text: Some parts of the U.S. are now grappling with a post-Thanksgiving surge of COVID-19 patients — while others dodged that fate. What lessons can we learn as we head into the Christmas season? https://t.co/vdEbC5aUuH

name: NPR
text: "It's classic Putin," says Konstantin Eggert, a Russian political commentator. "By not congratulating Biden for so long, he in his eyes at least proved that he's tough, he's strong, and, if need be, he's ready to take the fight all the way to Washington." https://t.co/EGgCDIGnHf

name: NPR
text: On the Warm Springs reservation in rural Oregon, work is underway to open an emergency housing site for people needing to isolate. Nearly 1 in 5 residents have tested positive for the coronavirus — and 14 have died from it. @OPB https://t.co/q1Zp2GFPre

name: NPR
text:
"My bank account has $4 in it right now. I would love the people in Washington who have decided not to give us more stimulus money to see what it's really like to live like this."
https://t.co/0pBE52S8dd

name: NPR
text:
RT @SachaPfeiffer: Remember the outrage over large companies getting Paycheck Protection Program money? The federal funding meant to help small businesses?

Many private charitable foundations also got PPP.

Some are linked to the families of Warren Buffett and Walt Disney: https://t.co/DJZ29gXqGW

name: NPR
text:
BREAKING: The House has approved a $900 billion coronavirus relief bill, after months of partisan sniping over what elements should be included in the measure. It heads to the Senate next.
https://t.co/WnVMnGIVtr

name: NPR
text: RT @NPR: In the 4-block radius where George Floyd was killed, residents and volunteers work to keep things running at the makeshift memorial. Here’s how one caretaker describes his mission to present what he calls an “aesthetic dignity” to the space. @MPRnews https://t.co/eaUjhFqH7c

name: NPR
text:
Here's the latest on the SolarWinds hack — including what investigators are doing now and how targeted agencies and companies are responding.
https://t.co/grj5xEhmQB

name: NPR
text:
Nearly 8 million people have fallen into poverty since the middle of the year, according to new data. Researchers attribute that sharp increase to the expiration of federal aid programs.
https://t.co/VcyPMdBmlL

name: NPR
text:
The Vatican says it's "morally acceptable" to get a COVID-19 vaccine, even if its research or production involved using cell lines derived from aborted fetuses, due to the "grave danger" of the pandemic.
https://t.co/noaUEJHs3z

name: NPR
text: A leader of the Proud Boys says he burned the Black Lives Matter banner at a D.C. church during a recent pro-Trump rally. Local police are investigating the incident as a hate crime. @DCist https://t.co/ooaRlRYfgB

name: NPR
text: The federal government has released an updated set of detailed hospital-level data showing the toll COVID-19 is taking on health care facilities, including how many inpatient and ICU beds are available on a weekly basis. https://t.co/JoO33e5mf4

name: NPR
text: Christopher Krebs, the former top cybersecurity official in the U.S., says Russia is to blame for a massive breach that's affected the State Dept., Pentagon, Treasury Dept. and Homeland Security. https://t.co/jVIqzjvt3u

name: NPR
text:
More than 70 West Point cadets have been accused of cheating on a calculus final exam in May after they all made the same errors on the test. It's the worst academic scandal since 1976, instructors say.
https://t.co/pOgRS6imp7

name: NPR
text:
Border Patrol plans to build 30-foot fences at Friendship Park, drastically altering the park's landscape on the U.S-Mexico border, which has tied the binational community together for years. @KPBSnews
https://t.co/8EWAGSQsRP

name: NPR
text:
New Zealand says it will provide free doses of coronavirus vaccines to its residents as well as neighboring nations Tokelau, Cook Islands, Niue, Samoa, Tonga, and Tuvalu, should they want them.
https://t.co/suF9Y16BMd

name: NPR
text: Mourning and celebrating. Coping and distancing. 2020 has been a year of collective emotional dissonance. Here are the stories that hit home in 2020. https://t.co/kRjqrM36u9

text: NPR’s Book Concierge has the largest batch of recommendations we’ve ever compiled – here are 380+ of our favorite 2020 titles. (And stick around to browse nearly 2,500 books from the last 8 years.) https://t.co/pB7fTkA9Mc
